THE FESTIVAL

Watch it Outside comes back in 2022, in Boston, to offer you the best of the western cinema.

From August 05 to 08, everyday from 6pm to 12am, you will have the chance to discover over 30 films carefully chosen for you! Comedies, romances, dramas, documentaries, westerns, classics... all genres will be represented! And for the youngest festival-goers, we have prepared a handful of animation movies.

The aim of the festival is to promote international cinema in all its forms as art, entertainment and as an industry. The Festival also organises retrospectives and tributes to major figures as a contribution towards a better understanding of the history of cinema.

Learn more

VENUE

This year the festival will take place in Boston Public Garden.

Oldest park in the city and first botanical garden of the United States, Boston Public Garden is the heart of the festival. With over 500 different species of flowers and trees, it offers a wonderful environment to gather and enjoy the magic of cinema.

The Boston Public Garden is located in downtown Boston, MA adjacent to the Boston Common, bounded by Bacon, Charles, Boylston, and Arlington Streets. It has been designated a National Historic Landmark.

See on map
